title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
OB: When opening the New Package Wizard in the Java IDE, the following message is displayed at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. At this point, the package name field is empty.
EB: When opening the New Package Wizard in the Java IDE, there should be no message displayed at the top when the package name field is empty. The message should only be shown when a package name is entered that conflicts with an existing folder. If an error occurs, it should be displayed in red with the error icon.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the New Package Wizard in the Java IDE.
2. Leave the package name field empty.
3. Observe that the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should not be displayed at the top.
